section.section: A domestic insurer, or a person that is primarily engaged directly or indirectly in the insurance business and that controls a domestic insurer, must file a statement with the Commissioner.

If the Commissioner determines that a person controlling a domestic insurer is, directly or through affiliates, primarily engaged in a business other than the insurance business, the person need not comply with paragraph (1) of this subsection.

text.section: The statement must be filed at least 60 days before a transaction subject to this subtitle is proposed to become effective.

section.section:
If the person required to file a statement under this section is a partnership, limited partnership, syndicate, or other group, the statement also shall include the information required by subsection (c) of this section for:
each partner of the partnership or limited partnership;
each member of the syndicate or group; and
each person controlling a partner or member.

If a person required to file the statement under this section is a corporation or if a person referred to in paragraph (1) of this subsection is a corporation, the statement also shall include the information required by subsection (c) of this section for:
the corporation;
each officer and director of the corporation; and
each person that directly or indirectly is the beneficial owner of more than 10% of the outstanding voting securities of the corporation.

text.section:
A person that is required to file a statement under this section instead may file with the Commissioner, in addition to any other materials that the Commissioner requests:
a registration statement filed under the Securities Act of 1933;
a disclosure containing similar information filed under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; or
a registration or disclosure that contains similar information filed under another State law.

section.section: Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, on request of the person filing the statement, the Commissioner may not make public the name of a lender listed under subsection (c)(6) of this section as a source of funds, unless the transaction is made in the lender's ordinary course of business.
The Commissioner may make public the name of a lender under paragraph (1) of this subsection if the Commissioner considers the disclosure to be in the public interest.

text.section: The Commissioner shall provide the statement filed under this section to the person to be acquired on the date the attempt to acquire is made public.
